name: Montgomery's pair correlation conjecture
rephrased: The zeros of the Riemann zeta function (when normalized to have a unit average spacing) tend to behave statistically like the eigenvalues of a random Hermitian matrix from the Gaussian Unitary Ensemble (GUE).
implication_form: If the zeros of the Riemann zeta function are normalized to have unit average spacing, then their two-point correlation function (pair correlation) approaches the sine-squared function correlation function of GUE eigenvalues as the height along the critical line goes to infinity.
